intro: Tecophilaea violiflora var. albida, commonly known as the white-flowered fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, lantern-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
